lead_paragraph: A University of Toledo basketball player who collapsed during conditioning drills died of a ruptured blood vessel to his heart, according to preliminary autopsy results released yesterday. Haris Charalambous, a backup center for Toledo, was stricken Monday as players started some light running during a routine workout. Charalambous, 21, of Manchester, England, played 23 games last season, averaging less than a point a game.
